required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Body Tilting on Diaphragm Excursion and Thickness in the Stroke Patients With Tracheotomy by Ultrasonography
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Body Tilting on Diaphragm Excursion and Thickness in the Stroke With Tracheotomy : Assessment by Ultrasonography

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to examine whether if the effect of standing with assistance of the tilt table on diaphragm excursion and thickness in the stroke patients with tracheotomy.

detailed_description.textblock: 40-45 stroke patients with tracheotomy were passive tilting (α=0°, 30°, 60°) by an electric tilt table in the random order. The diaphragm excursion and thickness were measured by ultrasonography on three tilting during the quiet breathing. Besides, the intraclass correlation coefficient (ICC) were calculated to assess the reliability of the diaphragm ultrasonography in this population.

primary_outcome.description: The measurement of the diaphragm dome excursion following the M-mode approach during quiet breathing could provide indirect information about inspiratory volume.
The diaphragm thickness was measured by B-mode approach providing clear visualization of the diaphragm morphology at the zone of apposition at the quiet breathing on the three tilting.

secondary_outcome.description: For the ultrasonography assessment, the intraclass correlation coefficient (ICC) was analyzed by using the two-way mixed-effects ICC [2.1] model with 95% confidence intervals (CIs).

intervention.description: The tilt table provides passive standing for the stroke patients with tracheotomy

study_pop.textblock: The stroke patients with tracheotomy was came from the Shenzhen Second People's Hospital .
